column4: Firefox is already running, but is not responding. To open a new window, you must first close the existing Firefox process, or restart your system.
but this time No Lock file ,not parent lock file
no you have to kill the pid of the firefox process
How do I know the process ID?
try type in the terminal ps -aux | grep firefox and u see in the first number u read is the pid of the process
strange.. seems to be u have no firefox process running.. u can't open now??
Warning: bad ps syntax, perhaps a bogus '-'? See http://procps.sf.net/faq.html
the first number changes everytime i run the ps aux ....
ok.. now try open again firefox
Firefox is already running, but is not responding. To open a new window, you must first close the existing Firefox process, or restart your system.
